intro: Ossaea rufescens var. pilifera, commonly known as the hairy red ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
